page.title: 05COUNTESTHORPE EDUCATION
page.content: Countesthorpe is notorious for its 'different' type of schools. Countesthorpe nursery school is for the three to five year olds. It isn't compulsory to go there and many parents send their children to play - school instead which is not run by the Education Authority. The infant and junior schools cater for the five to eleven year olds. Leysland High School (11-14) and Countesthorpe College (14-16/18) run slightly differently to most schools, children don't wear a uniform and they call their teachers by their christian names. This is to form closer relationships between teachers and pupils. All pupils have dance,drama and music lessons and take part in all aspects of design.
